[H1]Ideologies[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Ideologies in Civ4 Reimagined are a concept similar to Religions. Every Civilization can "adopt" one Ideology and this will have a big impact on diplomatic relations. Unlike Religions, Ideologies are determined by your Civic choices. Every Civic gives influence to certain Ideologies and decreases the influence to others. Each Civilization gets assigned the Ideology which has the biggest influence from its chosen Civics. Ideologies can unlock certain Wonders which get stronger with each Civilization that adopts your Ideology.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ideologies get activated after someone discovers the [LINK=literal]Liberalism[\LINK] technology. From that point on you can always see the different Ideology influences in your realm in the Civics screen. Also the icon next to a player in the scoreboard shows their current Ideology. Currently there exist four Ideologies in the game:[PARAGRAPH:1][H2]Conservatism [ICON_CONSERVATISM][\H2]This is the default Ideology. Conservative Civilizations choose Civics that are more authoritarian and protectionist. Choosing modern Civics will usually lead you away from Conservatism. Conservative Civilizations do not get a relation bonus towards each other.[PARAGRAPH:1][H2]Liberalism [ICON_LIBERALISM][\H2]Liberal Civics appear later in the game during the Industrial and Modern era. To adopt the liberal Ideology you need to choose liberal Civics in multiple directions. Establishing a free market and abolishing slavery is not enough if your Civilization is still ruled by a dictator.[PARAGRAPH:1][H2]Communism [ICON_COMMUNISM][\H2] Communism is characterized by a centrally planned economy. Still if you adopt other Civics like Capitalism that counter that approach too much, you will end up with another Ideology. Also adopting too totalitarian civics can push you towards becoming a fascist state.[PARAGRAPH:1][H2]Fascism [ICON_FASCISM][\H2]The fascist ideology is usually adopted by Civilizations going for all out wars with a totalitarian and autocratic government. The economic direction of a fascist state can be quite flexible as both capitalistic or socialist economies are plausible.
"Not as long your Ideology is so different..."
